qas.question: What controls the conferencing while its active on the signaling plane?
Where does the videoconferencing system manage conferencing creation?
What is one example of what the signaling plane controls in a videoconferencing system?
On what plane does the MC operate?
What generates output streams from each endpoint?
What does the MP control while active on the signaling plane?
Where does the system manage output streams while it is active?
What does the MC receive from in-conferencing controls?

plausible_answers.text: redirects the information to other endpoints in the conference.

qas.question: What does the signaling plane do with information in a conference?
What signaling negotiations does the MP operate on?

context: <a0_0>The MC<a0_0/> controls <b5_0>the conferencing<b5_0/> while it is active on <a1_0><b6_0>the signaling plane<b6_0/><a1_0/>, which is simply where the system manages conferencing creation, <a2_0>endpoint signaling<a2_0/> and in-conferencing controls. This component negotiates parameters with every endpoint in the network and controls conferencing resources. While the MC controls resources and signaling negotiations, the MP operates on <a3_0><b9_0>the media plane<b9_0/><a3_0/> and receives <b7_0>media<b7_0/> from each endpoint. <a4_0>The MP<a4_0/> generates output streams from each endpoint and <b8_0>redirects the information to other endpoints in the conference.
